humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, there are 6 lymph nodes in total, and one of them is positive for metastatic carcinoma. This corresponds to N1 stage as per the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes). The report mentions 'A single (of 6) lymph node is positive for metastatic carcinoma [AJCC pN1]', which supports this prediction.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for cancer staging is determined by the presence and extent of lymph node involvement. In this pathology report, it is stated that 'A single (of 6) lymph node is positive for metastatic carcinoma [AJCC pN1]' and 'Multiple (6) axillary lymph nodes are negative for metastatic carcinoma [AJCC pN1]'. This indicates that a total of 1 out of 7 lymph nodes tested positive for metastatic carcinoma. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.
